subtheme.en: Animals as part of God's creation
subtheme.pt: Animais como parte da cria√ß√£o de Deus

resolvedVerses.Genesis 1:24-25:
Genesis 1:24-25 ‚Äì And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.
 And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that
it was good.
resolvedVerses.Psalm 104:24-25:
Psalms 104:24-25 ‚Äì O LORD, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.
             So is this great and wide sea, wherein
are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.
resolvedVerses.Genesis 2:19:
Genesis 2:19 ‚Äì And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought
them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that
was the name thereof.
resolvedVerses.Job 12:7-10:
Job 12:7-10 ‚Äì But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:
 Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
 Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the LORD hath wrought this?
 In whose hand
is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.
resolvedVerses.Isaiah 11:6-7:
Isaiah 11:6-7 ‚Äì The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid; and the calf and the young lion and the fatling together; and a little child shall lead them.
 And the cow and the bear shall feed; their young ones shall lie down together: and the lion shall eat straw like the ox.
resolvedVerses.Matthew 10:29: Matthew 10:29 ‚Äì Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father.
resolvedVerses.Proverbs 12:10:
Proverbs 12:10 ‚Äì A righteous
man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked
are cruel.
resolvedVerses.Matthew 21:12: Matthew 21:12 ‚Äì And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves,
resolvedVerses.Luke 15:4-6:
Luke 15:4-6 ‚Äì What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?
 And when he hath found
it, he layeth
it
 on his shoulders, rejoicing.
 And when he cometh home, he calleth together
his friends and neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.
resolvedVerses.Matthew 6:26: Matthew 6:26 ‚Äì Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
resolvedVerses.Psalm 36:6:
Psalms 36:6 ‚Äì Thy righteousness
is like the great mountains; thy judgments
are a great deep: O LORD, thou preservest man and beast.
resolvedVerses.Psalm 145:9:
Psalms 145:9 ‚Äì The LORD
is good to all: and his tender mercies
are
 over all his works.
resolvedVerses.Proverbs 27:23:
Proverbs 27:23 ‚Äì Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks,
and look well to thy herds.
resolvedVerses.Jonah 1:17: Jonah 1:17 ‚Äì Now the LORD had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.
resolvedVerses.John 21:6:
John 21:6 ‚Äì And he said unto them,
Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find. They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.
resolvedVerses.Matthew 17:27: Matthew 17:27 ‚Äì Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of money: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.
resolvedVerses.Daniel 6:22: Daniel 6:22 ‚Äì My God hath sent his angel, and hath shut the lions mouths, that they have not hurt me: forasmuch as before him innocency was found in me; and also before thee, O king, have I done no hurt.
